<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Anti-virus</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>If a university becomes infected by viruses and spyware, repercussions can be felt off campus as well. As a result, IITS has purchased Sophos Anti-Virus, which is proven to deliver superior and proactive protection to safeguard our university's IT environments.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open About Sophos Anti-Virus">
					
                    About Sophos Anti-Virus
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Sophos Anti-Virus is a program that runs in the background of the operating system to protect your computer from malicious software and viruses. There are many ways Sophos helps protect your computer:</p>
<ul>
<li>Whether you're using your computer to browse the Internet, edit documents, or send email, Sophos will automatically scan all files for viruses before any actions are taken. For example, if you attempt to open a document that contains malicious software, Sophos will prevent it from opening and warn you of the possible threat.</li>
<li>It runs numerous scans for viruses and malicious software throughout the week.&nbsp;</li>
<li>It's controlled and monitored centrally by IITS. As a result, clients receive proper monitoring and their virus definitions remain up-to-date at all times. If any problems occur, they are easy to diagnose and resolved in a timely manner.</li>
</ul>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Installing Sophos Anti-Virus">
					
                    Installing Sophos Anti-Virus
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_0" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Sophos Anti-Virus can be obtained from IITS via email at&nbsp;<a href="mailto:license@concordia.ca">license@concordia.ca</a>. Please include the following information in your request:</p>
<ul>
<li>Full Name</li>
<li>Phone number</li>
<li>Department</li>
<li>Location of computer</li>
</ul>
<p>Students, faculty and staff can also install Sophos remotely.&nbsp; To access the download please follow these steps:</p>
<ul>
<li>Log in to <a href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">myconcordia.ca </a>with your netname and password</li>
<li>Click on Personal Services followed by Sophos Antivirus</li>
<li>Select your Operating System and follow the download steps</li>
</ul>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Sophos Anti-Virus Interface">
					
                    Sophos Anti-Virus Interface
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_1" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Once Sophos has been installed on your computer, you will notice a blue shield in the toolbar.</p>
<p><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/IITS/antivirus1.jpg"></p>
<p>Right click on the blue shield and select Open Sophos Anti-Virus to view the main control panel.</p>
<p><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/IITS/antivirus2.jpg"></p>
<p>Right-click on the blue shield and select Open Sophos Anti-Virus to view the main control panel.</p>
<p><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/IITS/antivirus3.jpg"></p>
<p>If, for some reason, the updates fail, the user will notice a grey shield with a red X. Contact the IITS Service Desk at 514-848-2424, ext. 7613.</p>
<p><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/IITS/antivirus4.jpg"></p>
<p>Users may also schedule their own regular scans or go directly into Sophos and click on Scan my computer.</p>
<p><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/IITS/antivirus5.jpg"> <img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/IITS/antivirus6.jpg"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

    
    <div class="container">    
        





<div class="breadcrumb breadcrumbs">

<section id="content-main">

    <div class="container">

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Wireless network</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><i>Pour obtenir des instructions <a href="/fr/iits/services/sans-fil.html" adhocenable="false">en franÃ§ais</a></i></p>
<p>Concordia University provides 802.11n compatible wireless networking for all of its currently registered students. Guest wireless accounts may be granted (for a small fee) to visitors who are unable to connect via the <a href="/iits/services/internet-phones/eduroam.html" adhocenable="false">Eduroam network</a>. To place a request for a guest wireless account fill out the following <a href="/iits/services/web-form.html" adhocenable="false">form</a>.</p>
<p style="margin-left: 40px;"><i><b>Note:</b> If you reached this page by connecting to the wireless network SSID 'ConcordiaGuest' you will only be able to browse through this website. After properly configuring your device using the instructions found below, you will be able to connect to the wireless network SSID 'ConcordiaUniversity' and access all websites.</i></p>

</div></div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Configuring your device for wireless access">
					
                    Configuring your device for wireless access
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Select your operating system and follow the instructions.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/iits/services/internet-phones/wireless-network/windows-7.html" adhocenable="false">Windows 7</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/internet-phones/wireless-network/windows-vista.html">Windows Vista</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/internet-phones/wireless-network/windows-xp.html">Windows XP</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/internet-phones/wireless-network/macosx.html">Mac OS-X</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/internet-phones/wireless-network/apple.html">iPhone, iPad &amp; iPod Touch</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/internet-phones/wireless-network/blackberry.html">Blackberry</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/internet-phones/wireless-network/android.html">Android *</a></li>
</ul>
<p><b>Note:</b> IITS is unable to provide specific instructions for devices not listed above.</p>
<p> * In addition, the IITS Service Desk and Services Areas are unable to provide official support for devices running Android, Linux and Unix platforms. To aid in the setup, please refer to Concordia's wireless authentication protocol, listed below.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   horizontalLines verticalLines table-striped">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><td>SSID:</td>
<td>Concordia University</td>
</tr><tr><td>Authentication:</td>
<td>WPA2 or WPA (WPA2 is preferred)</td>
</tr><tr><td>Encryption:</td>
<td>AES or TKIP (AES is preferred) with WPA2 Authentication, TKIP with WPA Authentication.</td>
</tr><tr><td>802.1x/EAP Type:</td>
<td>PEAP</td>
</tr><tr><td>Authentication Method:</td>
<td>MS-CHAP V2</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Although 802.11n technology is backward compatible with 802.11b,g,a, certain older legacy wireless adapters will require a firmware upgrade and driver update. Also, please note that some wireless adapters (produced before 2004) may need to be replaced.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Wireless Support">
					
                    Wireless Support
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_0" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Please do not hesitate to contact the Service Desk about a wireless issue.</p>
<ul>
<li><b>Webform:</b> Submit a support request via <a href="/iits/services/web-form.html" adhocenable="false">webform</a></li>
<li><b>In-person:</b> SGW: H925, LOY: CC207</li>
<li><b>Phone:</b> 514-848-2424 ext. 7613</li>
<li><b>E-mail:</b> <a href="mailto:help@concordia.ca">help@concordia.ca</a> *</li>
</ul>
<p>* When contacting the Service Desk via e-mail, please include the following information:</p>
<ul>
<li>Netname (student ID if unknown)</li>
<li>Email address</li>
<li>Phone number</li>
<li>Operating System (ex. Win XP, Mac OSX)</li>
<li>Wireless Interface <a adhocenable="false" href="/content/concordia/en/iits/services/internet-phones/wireless-network/#macaddress">Mac Address</a> (also referred to as Physical Address or Ethernet Address)</li>
<li>Exact date/time that you experienced problems</li>
<li>Specific building and room number (not just the floor number)</li>
<li>Error message or detailed description of what occurred</li>
</ul>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="macaddress"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open How to obtain your computer's mac address">
					
                    How to obtain your computer's mac address
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_1" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><h4>Windows XP &amp; Vista</h4>
<ul>
<li>Click <b>Start</b> and select <b>Run</b></li>
<li>In the run prompt type <b>cmd</b> and press enter</li>
<li>A black text window will appear on your screen.</li>
<li>Type <b>ipconfig/all</b> and then press enter</li>
<li>Make note of the <b>Physical address</b></li>
</ul>
<h4>Windows 7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Click on the network icon in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen, just to the left of the clock.</li>
<li>Select <b>Open Network and Sharing Centre</b>.</li>
<li>Click <b>Change adapter settings</b> on the left panel.</li>
<li>Double-click on <b>Local Area Connection</b>.</li>
<li>Click on the <b>Details</b> button.</li>
<li>The MAC address is listed as <b>Physical Address</b>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>MAC OS X</h4>
<ul>
<li>Go to the apple menu and select <b>About this Mac</b></li>
<li>In the about box, you will see a button labeled <b>More Info</b></li>
<li>Click <b>More Info</b>, and you will launch OS X's <b>System Profiler</b></li>
<li>Once in the profiler, you can select <b>Network</b>, which will display the <b>Ethernet Address</b></li>
</ul>
</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="cache"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Clearing your computer's cache (Windows only)">
					
                    Clearing your computer's cache (Windows only)
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_2" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>When you successfully log on to a wireless or wired network that uses Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (PEAP) authentication, your credentials are automatically stored in the computer for reuse. This may sometimes interfere with your computer's ability to accept new credentials. To clear the cache, visit the following <a href="http://support.microsoft.com/kb/823731" target="_blank" adhocenable="false">Microsoft Support Page</a>.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>When you successfully log on to a wireless or wired network that uses Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (PEAP) authentication, your credentials are automatically stored in the computer for reuse. This may sometimes interfere with your computer's ability to accept new credentials. To clear the cache, visit the following&nbsp;<a href="http://support.microsoft.com/kb/823731">Microsoft Support Page</a>.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"><div class="box_0 parbase box">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark " style=" color: # !important;   ">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">

</div></div>

<script type="text/javascript" src="/etc/clientlibs/granite/jquery/granite.min.js"></script>

    <link rel="stylesheet" href="/etc/designs/concordia/clientlibs/bootstrap.min.css" type="text/css">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Email for students</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Concordia University current students are eligible for a Microsoft Office 365 email account.</p>
<p>Current students are eligible to activate an Office 365 email account.</p>
<h3>To activate the account, follow these steps:</h3>
<ul>
<li>Log into your MyConcordia Portal</li>
<li>Click on Personal Services followed by Computer Accounts and Passwords</li>
<li>Select âEmail Office365â and accept the terms of agreement</li>
<li>Your account will be accessible within 24 hours</li>
</ul>
<h3>Your account information:</h3>
<ul>
<li>Email address format: your_netname@live.concordia.ca</li>
<li>Username &amp; password: your myconcordia netname and password</li>
<li>Accessing your mailbox: https://outlook.com/live.concordia.ca</li>
</ul>
<p>Office365 accounts may also be set up in an e-mail client. For instructions please select your e-mail client from the list below. If your e-mail client is not in the list below, please contact Microsoft directly for assistance.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/iits/services/email-collaboration/email-for-students/outlook.html" adhocenable="false">Outlook</a></li>
<li><a href="/iits/services/email-collaboration/email-for-students/thunderbird.html" adhocenable="false">Thunderbird</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Support</h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="/iits/services/email-collaboration/email-for-students/office365-faq.html" adhocenable="false">Frequently Asked Questions</a></li>
<li>Password problems:<ul>
<li>Webform: Submit a support request via <a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/web-form.html">webform</a></li>
<li>Phone: 514-848-2424 ext. 7613</li>
<li>E-mail: help@concordia.ca</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>All other problems/questions:<ul>
<li>Contact Microsoft directly via the <a href="https://outlook.com/live.concordia.ca">Service Desk Centre</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"><div class="box_2 parbase box">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark " style=" color: # !important;   ">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">

</div></div>

	                    <li class=""><a href="/iits/services/email-collaboration/email-for-students/office365-faq.html"  >Office365</a></li></ul>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

                        <span class="sprites-icon-social-5" displayText="LinkedIn" st_image='http://www.concordia.ca/content/concordia/en/iits/services/software-applications/ms-office.img.png/1376573466849.png'>LinkedIn</span>
                    </a>
                </li>
            </ul>   
        </div>

        <script type="text/javascript">
            jQuery(function() {  
                $ = jQuery;
                socialbar.init();
                jQuery(window).scroll(function(){
                    socialbar.scroll();
                });
    
            });
        </script></div>


            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Applications: MS Office</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<div class="main_content span_13 alpha"><p>Concordia University subscribes to a Campus Agreement with Microsoft. All University owned computers and devices are covered under the current agreement which includes free access to:</p>
<ul>
<li>Microsoft Windows Operating System Upgrades,</li>
<li>Latest versions of Microsoft Office Suite,</li>
<li>Core Client Access Licenses (CAL) Suite,</li>
<li>Exchange Server Enterprise CAL (Unified Messaging), and</li>
<li>Programs provided with the Campus Agreement</li>
</ul>
<p class="desc"><b>Note:</b> The Campus Agreement does not include software products such as Visio, MS-Project, etc.</p>
<p>For more information please review the <a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/software-applications/ms-office/microsoft.html">Summary of the Concordia Microsoft Campus Agreement</a>.</p>
</div>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

<ul style='display:block;'></ul>
</div>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(function() {
    $ = jQuery;
    $("#secondary_navigation.c-secondary-navigation .arrow").click(function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var $this = $(this);
        $this.toggleClass('open');
        $this.parent().children('ul').slideToggle('fast');
    });
});
</script></div>
<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"><div class="box_1 parbase box">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark " style=" color: # !important;   ">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="title section">

				            </li>
                    </ul> 
	            </li>

            	
            	<li class="dropdown ">
					
						<a href="/iits/news-alerts.html" role="button">News &amp; alerts</a>
	            </li>

            	
            	<li class="dropdown ">
					
                    <a href="/iits/about-iits.html" role="button" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="">About IITS</a>
                    <ul class="dropdown-menu">
                    		<li class="">
					            <a tabindex="-1" href="/iits/about-iits/departments.html">Departments</a>
				            </li>
                    </ul> 
	            </li>
        </ul>
	</div>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Software purchasing</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<div class="main_content span_13 alpha"><p>Listed <a>here</a> are the applications that make up the Concordia University standard software images, installed on every standard computer. Concordiaâs software licenses are now centralized through site license agreements for the commonly used software. New computers are now equipped with the latest software available and information on obtaining new software is available through your <a>departmental IT representative.</a></p>
<p>For information on other software, please send an e-mail to <a>license@concordia.ca</a> with any questions you may have.</p>
<h2>Software licenses</h2>
<p>Concordiaâs software licenses are now centralized through site license agreements for the commonly used software. New computers are now equipped with the latest software available and information on obtaining new software is available through your <a>departmental IT representative.</a></p>
<p>For web requisitioning authorization, please contact Mario Paradis at <a>Mario.Paradis@concordia.ca</a>. For all other questions, contact Aurelia Munteanu in Concordiaâs Purchasing Department, 514-848-2424, ext. 3650, or at <a>amunean@alcor.concordia.ca</a>.</p>
<ul>
<li><a rel="external" class="iits">Apple</a></li>
<li><a rel="external" class="iits">Maplesoft</a></li>
<li><a>Mathematica</a></li>
<li><a rel="external" class="iits">Microsoft</a></li>
<li><a>Microsoft Office 365 for education â Privacy FAQ</a></li>
<li><a rel="external" class="iits">SAS</a></li>
<li><a rel="external" class="iits">Sophos</a></li>
<li><a rel="external" class="iits">SPSS</a></li>
</ul>
</div>

</div></div>


</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

    <div class="container">

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Moodle</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Moodle is a course management system designed to help educators create effective online learning communities. It provides students with access to quizzes, discussions, class notes, and more.</p>
<h4>Upgraded version of Moodle introduced in 2013</h4>
<p>A new version of Moodle was introduced May 1, 2013 at Concordia. Moodle 2.3 boasts myriad new and improved features that include automatic blogs, wikis, live chat and drag-and-drop functionality.&nbsp;</p>
<p>If you require assistance accessing course content from the previous version of Moodle, please contact the IITS Service Desk at 514-848-2424, ext. 7613 or at <a href="mailto:help@concordia.ca">help@concordia.ca</a>.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Will everything in our current version appear in my new site?">
					
                    Will everything in our current version appear in my new site?
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Everything in the current version of Moodle (v.1.9) will automatically be migrated (with the exception of old NanoGong sound files). You will not have to transfer any files.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open What happens to my files after the upgrade?">
					
                    What happens to my files after the upgrade?
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_0" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>File management is quite different in Moodle 2.3. There is no longer any Files folder. Users no longer have to make links to files, they are simply added to an activity or other location and available from there. Files that are stored in your âFilesâ? folder on the old Moodle will appear in a âLegacy Course Filesâ? folder.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Will my assignments be affected?">
					
                    Will my assignments be affected?
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_2" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Assignments will not be affected, though it is important that you check that all settings are still correct.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open What improvements can we expect in Moodle 2.3?">
					
                    What improvements can we expect in Moodle 2.3?
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_3" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>There are many improvements. Among them:</p>
<ul>
<li>An improved navigation and file upload system (drag-and-drop!)</li>
<li>The ability to copy activities and resources</li>
<li>Completion and activity tracking is available</li>
<li>Site-wide groups, or Cohorts, are available</li>
<li>Existing Moodle modules such as the Wiki, Quiz, and, Workshop are now easier to manage and much more user-friendly</li>
<li>The HTML editor has been replaced with a new version known as Tiny MCE, which will work with most web browsers, unlike Moodle's previous HTML editor.</li>
</ul>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Where can I get training?">
					
                    Where can I get training?
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_4" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Workshops on Moodle 2.3 are available now and we will continue to offer them throughout the summer. You can <a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/support/training.html">register for the workshops online</a>.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Where can I get support?">
					
                    Where can I get support?
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_5" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Please contact the <a href="mailto:help@concordia.ca">Service Desk</a> if you need assistance with these items or have other Moodle questions.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="support"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Support">
					
                    Support
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_6" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Students should contact the Service Desk for Moodle support.</p>
<ul>
<li>Webform: Submit a support request via <a href="/iits/services/web-form.html" adhocenable="false">webform</a></li>
<li>Phone: 514-848-2424 ext. 7613</li>
<li>E-mail: <a href="mailto:help@concordia.ca">help@concordia.ca</a></li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"><div class="box_3 parbase box">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark " style=" color: # !important;   ">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<H1>Computer labs &amp; equipment</H1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>ITS offers a wide range of computing resources, electronic and media-related equipment to the Concordia community.</p>
<p>The Sir George Williams (SGW) campus and the Loyola campus offer many facilities, from PC and Mac labs to video &amp; sound editing and digital imaging facilities.</p>
<h3>Labs</h3>
<p>You can find labs in the following locations:</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   horizontalLines verticalLines table-striped">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th>SGW</th>
<th>Loyola</th>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">&nbsp;</td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/computers-equipment/labs-equipment/labs-loyola.html#208">CC-208</a></td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;"><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/computers-equipment/labs-equipment/labs-sgw.html#517">H-517</a></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/computers-equipment/labs-equipment/labs-loyola.html#211">CC-211</a></td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;"><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/computers-equipment/labs-equipment/labs-sgw.html#923">H-923</a></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/computers-equipment/labs-equipment/labs-loyola.html#213">CC-213</a></td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;"><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/computers-equipment/labs-equipment/labs-sgw.html#980">H-980</a></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/computers-equipment/labs-equipment/labs-loyola.html#214">CC-214-1</a></td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">&nbsp;</td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/computers-equipment/labs-equipment/labs-loyola.html#215">CC-215</a></td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>
<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2 class="section-header ">Service Centres</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>A wide variety of electronic and media-related equipment is available from Concordia University's service centres. Most of the equipment is available to all students, faculty and staff.</p>
<p>Available equipment includes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Video/data projectors</li>
<li>Laptops</li>
<li>Digital cameras</li>
<li>Document cameras</li>
<li>CD players, and much more!</li>
</ul>
<p>Please consult the <a href="/iits/services/computers-equipment/labs-equipment/guide.html" adhocenable="false">IITS Equipment Loan and Rental Guide</a> for details on bookings, pricing, and user classification.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"></div>
</div>
<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"></div>
</div>
<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"></div>
</div>
<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"><div class="box_0 parbase box">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark " style=" color: # !important;   ">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2 class="section-header ">SGW Campus Service Centres</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><b>H Building: H-421</b><br>
Phone: 514-848-2424, ext. 3435<br>
Hours: Mon-Thur: 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m., Fri: 8:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m.</p>
<p><b>MB Building: S 2.145</b><br>
Phone: 514-848-2424, ext. 5998<br>
Hours: Mon-Thur: 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m., Fri: 8:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m., Sat: 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.</p>
<p><i>Note: hours are subject to change</i>.<br>
</p>

</div></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>VoIP FAQ</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><b>FAQ's â VoIP TELEPHONE SYSTEM</b></p>
<p><b>Q. How do I order a new phone?</b><br>
A. You must submit a request for a new telephone to the IITS Service Desk by calling ext. 7613 or by sending an e-mail to the <a href="mailto:help@concordia.ca">IITS Service Desk</a> . A ticket will be issued to you in order to track your request. Once you have a ticket number, please contact Steven Zulkarnain from the Concordia Computer Store at x3625 (or email <a adhocenable="false" href="mailto:steven.zulkarnain@concordia.ca">steven.zulkanain@concordia.ca</a>) to place your telephone order; you will need to quote the ticket number given to you by the Service Desk.<b> </b>The phone will be delivered directly to Voice Services for programming and will be installed by one of our technicians. <b>Please note:</b>&nbsp; The Service Desk will only accept requests from <a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/internet-phones/telephone-services/help.html">Telephone Coordinators</a> for phone orders.</p>
<p><b>Q.</b> <b>How do I change the information on a telephone's call display?</b><br>
A. This is a programming change that is done by Voice Services. Please contact the IITS Service Desk in order to request call display update.<br>
</p>
<p><b>Q. How do I add or remove voicemail and/or long distance access on my telephone?</b><br>
A. These are features that are managed by Voice Services. Please contact the IITS Service Desk to submit a request to add, modify, or remove these features.<br>
<b>Please note:</b>&nbsp; The Service Desk will only accept requests from <a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/internet-phones/telephone-services/help.html">Telephone Coordinators</a> for phone orders.</p>
<p><b>Q. I can't forward my extension to an external number such as my home or my cell phone. How do I get this service?</b><br>
A. By default, many phones are restricted to forwarding their calls to internal numbers. Please contact the IITS Service Desk to request external call forwarding.</p>
<p><b>Q.</b> <b>How can I add or modify an extension number on my telephone?</b><br>
A. Voice Services must program this for you. Please contact the IITS Service Desk to request this programming modification. <b>Please note:</b>&nbsp; The Service Desk will only accept requests from <a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/internet-phones/telephone-services/help.html">Telephone Coordinators</a> for phone orders.</p>
<p><b>Q.</b> <b>How can I have my information updated in the university's online directory?</b><br>
A. You can submit a directory update by filling out a Directory Update form, located in the Intranet section of the Voice Services website &gt; Directory Services.</p>
<p><b>Q. Where can I find information on the costs related to telephone services?</b><br>
A. Please visit our Rates section for details. If you have further questions, please submit a rates inquiry to the IITS Service Desk.</p>
<p><b>Q.</b> <b>How can I get information on how much my department is being billed for telephone services?</b><br>
A. You can submit your inquiry by filling out a <a adhocenable="false" href="http://portico.concordia.ca/cq/voip/billing-inquires/index.shtml">Billing Inquiries</a> form.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><b>FAQ's â UNITY CONNECTION VOICE-MAIL SYSTEM</b></p>
<p><b>Q. What is my Cisco ID?</b><br>
A. Your Cisco ID is your telephone extension.</p>
<p><b>Q. What is my PIN?</b><br>
A. Your PIN is your voice-mail password.</p>
<p><b>Q. I have forgotten my PIN. How can I reset my PIN?</b><br>
A. Contact the IITS Service Desk and request a PIN reset. The IITS Service Desk can be reached at extension 7613 or at <a href="mailto:help@concordia.ca" adhocenable="false">help@concordia.ca</a>.</p>
<p><b>Q. I'm trying to set a new PIN but the system keeps rejecting it, saying it is invalid?</b><br>
A. In order to be accepted by the system your PIN must follow the guidelines described in the <a adhocenable="false" href="/iits/services/internet-phones/telephone-services/unity.html">Unity Voicemail &gt; Setting Up Voicemail</a> section.<br>
</p>
<p><b>Q. What number do I dial to access voice-mail from my office telephone?</b><br>
A. You can reach the voice-mail system from your office phone by pressing the message key or by dialing 4220.</p>
<p><b>Q. How do I access voice-mail from off-campus?</b><br>
A. Dial 514-848-4220. When you hear the prompt: âWelcome to Concordia University's Unified Messaging. If you have a voice mailbox on this system, please press starâ?, press the * key and enter your ID (your telephone extension), followed by #. Enter your PIN (voice-mail password) followed by #.</p>
<p><b>Q. Where can I find a description of the prompts used by the system?</b><br>
A. The prompts are virtually the same. To get a copy of the updated voice-mail map, click here:<br>
<a href="/content/dam/concordia/docs/IITS/Phones/Voice-mail_UserGuide_8.0.pdf" adhocenable="false">Voice-mail_UserGuide_8.0.pdf</a>.</p>
<p><b>Q. What is the website where I can access my PCA Messaging Inbox?</b><br>
A.<a href="https://unity.concordia.ca/ciscopca" adhocenable="false"> https://unity.concordia.ca/ciscopca</a> You can safely click 'Yes' in response to any security alerts that may appear as you use this website. The Cisco PCA website uses pop-up windows. If you have pop-up blocker software installed, configure it to enable pop-ups for this site.</p>
<p><b>Q. What is the username and password for my Cisco PCA?</b><br>
A. Your MyConcordia portal netname and password. If these login credentials do not work, contact the IITS Service Desk at extension 7613 or<a href="mailto:help@concordia.ca"> help@concordia.ca</a> .</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"><div class="parbase box box_5">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark " style=" color: # !important;   ">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">

</script>

</footer>
    </div>

</body>
</html>
</IIR>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

        <div class="span8">
            <div class="post highlighted">            
                <h1 class="article-title">Safety first</h1>
                
                <div class="subtitle">University policy highlights resources and guidelines to maintaining security</div>
                
                <div class="clearfix"></div>
                <div class="infos">
	                <div class="date">Posted on October 2, 2012</div>
	                <div class="separator">|</div>
	                <div class="author">
	                   <div class="author parbase picker">






	<span>By: Isabel Rut</span>
</div>

	                </div>
	                <div class="source">
	                   <div class="single source">





</div>
                
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <div class="rte">
                    <div class="parbase details wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p><i>This article is the fourth in a series of seven, published weekly on important Concordia policies. This is part of a policy-awareness campaign that will culminate in employees being asked to confirm that they have read the policies when they access </i>myempath<i> in the MyConcordia portal following the publication of the last story. </i><br /> <br /> We all believe we conduct our lives safely.&nbsp; We don&rsquo;t walk in front of moving buses or enter burning buildings. We do, however, take certain situations for granted.</p> <p>VPS-20, the Security Policy, has been developed to inform employees about what to do in situations that are not perceived as dangerous, but could pose a substantial risk.</p><p>&ldquo;The Concordia Security Policy identifies potentially unsafe situations or environments where an employee&rsquo;s wellbeing may be at risk and provides resources and established guidelines to pursue the safest course of action,&rdquo; says Senior Director of Environmental Health, Safety and Security, Richard Young. &ldquo;For example, if an employee is denied access to a room or activity by a person or group of people who are unauthoroized to prohibit access, the Department of Security should be notified by calling extension 3717 and resources will be dispatched to ensure the employee&rsquo;s safety and right to entry.&rdquo;</p><div style="float:right; display:inline; margin:0 0 1em 15px; width:350px;" class="img_wrapper"><div class="inner_shadow"><img width="350" height="233" alt="The security department is there to assure our safety. | Photo by Concordia University" src="safety-first/_jcr_content/images/image_jpg_0.img.jpg"/></div> <div class="caption">The security department is there to assure our safety. | Photo by Concordia University</div></div><p>The policy also identifies processes for the removal of equipment and materials, the securing of space and facilities and special security coverage. It defines illegal behaviour, fraud and theft, as well as lost and found items and guidelines to follow under specific circumstances.<br /> <br /> &nbsp;&ldquo;At Concordia, the safety and security of all of our employees is paramount, which is why it is important for all our employees to be familiar with this policy,&rdquo; says Associate Vice-President, Human Resources. Carolina Willsher.<br /> &nbsp;<br /> All Concordia employees are encouraged to review the complete Security Policy for more details. Additionally, there is a range of other important policies available on this site that have been developed to clarify ambiguous situations, which may be relevant to employees within specific departments. See the question and answer section on the Human Resources page under policies and procedures for a full list of policies related to the awareness campaign.<br /> <b><br /> Related links:</b><br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Code exists to protect&quot; &ndash; NOW, September 12, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Policy awareness campaign highlights employee Code of Ethics&quot; &ndash; NOW, September 19, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Protecting of Personal Information&quot; &ndash; NOW, September 26, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Security Policy (VPS-20)<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Official Concordia policies website and Q&amp;A<br /> <br /> <br />    <br /> &nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p> 
</div></div>

                </div>
                <div class="parsys">




</div>

                <hr>
                <div class="related-links parbase picker">






</div>

            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c-sidebar span4">
            <div class="parsys story-parsys">


<div class="join-the-conversation section">








</div>


</div>

            <div class="parbase list list-related-stories related-stories">


</div>

            <div class="related-topics">

	            policies            
	        </a>
	    
	        <a href="/news/stories/topics.html?topic=topics:general_interest/public_safety" class="btn btn-tag btn-small">
	            public safety            
	        </a>
	    
    </div>
    <hr>
</div>

            <div class="experts parbase find-an-expert box">

    <h4 class="section-header">FIND AN EXPERT</h4>
    <p>Search for an expert to comment on any topic.<br><span class="muted">Enter a phrase or keyword</span></p>
    
    <form action="/news/media-relations/find-an-expert.html" method="GET">
        <fieldset>            
            <div class="input-append control-group">
                <div class="controls">
                    <input class="input-large" type="text" value="" name="keywords">
                    <button type="submit" class="btn"><i class="icon-search icon-white"></i></button>
                </div>
            </div>
        </fieldset>
    </form>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

        <div class="span8">
            <div class="post highlighted">            
                <h1 class="article-title">Promoting a culture of safety</h1>
                
                <div class="subtitle">University policy highlights roles and responsibilities for maintaining environmental health and safety</div>
                
                <div class="clearfix"></div>
                <div class="infos">
	                <div class="date">Posted on October 10, 2012</div>
	                <div class="separator">|</div>
	                <div class="author">
	                   <div class="author parbase picker">






	<span>By: Isabel Rut</span>
</div>

	                </div>
	                <div class="source">
	                   <div class="single source">





</div>
                
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <div class="rte">
                    <div class="parbase details wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p><i>This article is the fifth in a series of seven, published weekly on important Concordia policies. This is part of a policy-awareness campaign that will culminate in employees being asked to confirm that they have read the policies when they access </i>myempath<i> in the MyConcordia portal following the publication of the last story. </i><br /> <br /> Every employee &mdash; executives, faculty members and support staff &mdash; has&nbsp; a responsibility under the Concordia Environmental Health and Safety Policy (VPS-40) to ensure a secure and healthy school and work environment.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <div class="img_wrapper" style="float:right; display:inline; margin:0 0 1em 15px; width:350px;"><div class="inner_shadow"><img width="350" height="237" src="promoting-a-culture-of-safety/_jcr_content/images/image_jpg_0.img.jpg" alt=""/></div></div> <p>&ldquo;The Environmental Health and Safety Policy clearly identifies the roles and responsibilities of every member of the Concordia community,&rdquo; says Senior Director of Environmental Health, Safety and Security, Richard Young.&nbsp; &ldquo;It supports the internal responsibility system and complies with the Quebec Health and Safety at Work law by providing employee and student input into decisions which may affect their overall well-being.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> This policy was amended in 2004 to expand the scope of the university&rsquo;s responsibility under federal law C-21, which amends the criminal code by specifically addressing the health and safety responsibilities of employees. &ldquo;Essentially, the policy outlines the levels of responsibility within Concordia, descending from the President&rsquo;s Executive Group through the various levels of supervision to the individual employee and student, with accountability passing back up,&rdquo; says Vice-President, Services, Roger C&ocirc;t&eacute;.<br /> <br /> It also encompasses emergency management responsibilities to comply with Canadian standards, Quebec law and our university insurance advisor&rsquo;s recommendations. <br /> <br /> &ldquo;Thousands of people grace our halls daily, so ensuring everyone&rsquo;s health and safety must be a collaborative effort,&rdquo; says Associate Vice-President, Human Resources, Carolina Willsher.<br /> &nbsp;<br /> All Concordia employees are encouraged to review the complete Environmental Health and Safety Policy for more details. There are also other important policies on this site, which has been developed to clarify ambiguous conditions relevant to employees in specific departments. See the question-and-answer section on the Human Resources page under &ldquo;policies and procedures&rdquo; for a full list of policies related to the awareness campaign.<br /> <br /> <b>Related links:</b><br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Code exists to protect&quot; &ndash; NOW, September 12, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Policy awareness campaign highlights employee Code of Ethics&quot; &ndash; NOW, September 19, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Protecting of Personal Information&quot; &ndash; NOW, September 26, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Safety First&quot; &ndash; NOW, October 3, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Environmental Health and Safety Policy (VPS-40)<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Official Concordia policies website and Q&amp;A<br /> <br /> <br /> <br /> &nbsp;</p> 
</div></div>

                </div>
                <div class="parsys">




</div>

                <hr>
                <div class="related-links parbase picker">






</div>

            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c-sidebar span4">
            <div class="parsys story-parsys">

</div>


</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

        <div class="span8">
            <div class="post highlighted">            
                <h1 class="article-title">Shining a light on harassment</h1>
                
                <div class="subtitle">University policy highlights education and prevention of unwanted behaviour</div>
                
                <div class="clearfix"></div>
                <div class="infos">
	                <div class="date">Posted on October 15, 2012</div>
	                <div class="separator">|</div>
	                <div class="author">
	                   <div class="author parbase picker">






	<span>By: Isabel Rut</span>
</div>

	                </div>
	                <div class="source">
	                   <div class="single source">





</div>
                
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <div class="rte">
                    <div class="parbase details wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p><i>This article is the sixth in a series of seven, published weekly on important Concordia policies. This is part of a policy-awareness campaign that will culminate in employees being asked to confirm that they have read the policies when they access </i>myempath<i> in the MyConcordia portal following the publication of the last story. </i><br /> <br /> Childhood bullying makes news. Schools are aware of the trauma this form of harassment can cause and are equipped with educational programs, specialists and tools to identify, treat and eliminate such unwanted behaviour.&nbsp;</p> <p>When harassment occurs in the workplace, it is more difficult to diagnose and remedy, as it is rarely overt and can be interpreted as managing, moodiness or teasing. How can we be sure?</p><div class="img_wrapper" style="float:right; display:inline; margin:0 0 1em 15px; width:350px;"><div class="inner_shadow"><img width="350" height="233" src="shining-a-light-on-harassment/_jcr_content/images/image_jpg_0.img.jpg" alt=""/></div></div><p>Harassment, as defined by Concordia&rsquo;s Code of Rights and Responsibilities (BD-3), constitutes repeated, ongoing and unwelcome, troublesome conduct that could be in the form of sexual or psychological harassment or the kind that breaks laws governing a person&rsquo;s right to work in a safe and civil manner.<br /> <br /> &ldquo;People generally recognize when they are being harassed. Psychological harassment really can affect a member&rsquo;s dignity,&rdquo; explains Concordia&rsquo;s Director and Senior Advisor, Rights and Responsibilities, Louise Shiller. &ldquo;It can affect their psychological and/or physical integrity. All forms of harassment can interfere with a person&rsquo;s right to pursue their work or study in a safe and civil manner. Basically, harassment can create an intimidating or hostile environment.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> Concordia&rsquo;s Harassment, Sexual Harassment and Psychological Harassment Policy (HR-38) highlights awareness, education and prevention as the best strategy for eliminating such behaviour. The policy was developed to ensure employees have the opportunity to learn about what constitutes harassment and advise them on how to handle situations that may be distressing. <br /> <br /> This year, the Office of Rights and Responsibilities has teamed up with the Department of Human Resources to deliver a course that informs and trains managers and supervisors on the provisions of the Act Respecting Labour Standards as they relate to psychological harassment, as well as the terms of HR-38 and the Code of Rights and Responsibilities. It will be offered throughout the year for managers and supervisors of the university.<br /> <br /> &ldquo;We wanted to offer a course that would facilitate the identification of harassment and provide tools for managers when faced with these potentially difficult situations,&rdquo; says Andr&eacute;e-Anne Bouchard, manager of Employee Relations. &ldquo;It is not healthy or sustainable to work in an intimidating atmosphere and we want employees to know that they are respected and supported by the university.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> All Concordia employees are encouraged to review the policy on Harassment, Sexual Harassment and Psychological Harassment (HR-38), as well as the Code of Rights and Responsibilities (BD-3) for more details. There are also other important policies available on the Official Concordia Policies website that have been developed to clarify ambiguous conditions, which may be relevant to employees within specific departments. See the question-and-answer section on the Human Resources page under &ldquo;policies and procedures&rdquo; for a full list of policies related to the awareness campaign.<br /> <br /> <b>Related links:</b><br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Harassment, Sexual Harassment and Psychological Harassment Policy (HR-38)<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Code of Rights and Responsibilities (BD-3)<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Code exists to protect&quot; &ndash; NOW, September 12, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Policy awareness campaign highlights employee Code of Ethics&quot; &ndash; NOW, September 19, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Protecting of Personal Information&quot; &ndash; NOW, September 26, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Safety First&quot; &ndash; NOW, October 3, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Promoting a culture of safety&quot; &ndash; NOW, October 10, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; FAQ - Policy on Harassment, Sexual Harassment and Psychological Harassment (HR-38) <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Official Concordia policies website and Q&amp;A<br /> <br /> <br /> <br /> &nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p> 
</div></div>

                </div>
                <div class="parsys">




</div>

                <hr>
                <div class="related-links parbase picker">






</div>

            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="c-sidebar span4">
            <div class="parsys story-parsys">


<div class="join-the-conversation section">








</div>


</div>

</div>

	        </a>

	            policies            
	        </a>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

        <div class="span8">
            <div class="post highlighted">            
                <h1 class="article-title">Signing on the dotted line</h1>
                
                <div class="subtitle">University policy highlights proper protocol to respect when authorizing contracts</div>
                
                <div class="clearfix"></div>
                <div class="infos">
	                <div class="date">Posted on October 23, 2012</div>
	                <div class="separator">|</div>
	                <div class="author">
	                   <div class="author parbase picker">






	<span>By: Isabel Rut</span>
</div>

	                </div>
	                <div class="source">
	                   <div class="single source">





</div>
                
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <div class="rte">
                    <div class="parbase details wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p><i>This article is the last in a series of seven, published weekly on important Concordia policies. This is part of a policy-awareness campaign that will culminate in employees being asked to confirm that they have read the policies when they access </i>my empath<i> in the MyConcordia portal beginning November 1.</i><br /> <br /> Some Concordia employees may, in the course of their work, be required to sign contracts with individuals or firms. So it&rsquo;s important for all employees to understand Concordia&rsquo;s signing protocol before entering into any contractual obligation. <br /> <br /> &ldquo;Concordia&rsquo;s Policy on Signing Authority and Required Approvals has been created to ensure that there is no ambiguity or question as to who can authorize a contract,&rdquo; says Vice-President, Institutional Relations and Secretary-General, Bram Freedman. &ldquo;It is important for all university employees to familiarize themselves with this policy to ensure that they understand the implications of endorsing a contract on behalf of the university.&rdquo;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <div class="img_wrapper" style="float:right; display:inline; margin:0 0 1em 15px; width:350px;"><div class="inner_shadow"><img width="350" height="233" src="signing-on-the-dotted-line/_jcr_content/images/image_jpg_0.img.jpg" alt="Understand the policy prior to committing to a contract. | Photo by Concordia University"/></div> <div class="caption">Understand the policy prior to committing to a contract. | Photo by Concordia University</div></div> <p>As indicated in the signing authority policy (BD-1), an employee cannot authorize a contract on the university&rsquo;s behalf unless he or she has signing authority as a designated signing officer.<br /> <br /> Before signing a contract, the officer must be satisfied that certain conditions have been met and must be responsibile for overseeing that all obligations on the part of the university and the other parties are met. The contract must comply with relevant legislation, collective agreements and university policies and procedures. <br /> <br /> The term &ldquo;contract&rdquo; is also clearly defined, as it can represent any written or verbal agreement, contract, letter of intent, memorandum of understanding or memorandum of agreement, the provisions of which are binding upon the university.<br /> <br /> The signing authority policy clearly outlines who, within the university, can enter into a contract on the university&rsquo;s behalf and under which conditions. It also stipulates the maximum value of a contract. Depending on the total value and type of expenditure, varying levels of approval are required.<br /> <br /> &ldquo;When in doubt, refer to the policy,&rdquo; says Freedman. &ldquo;It can save a great deal of misunderstanding, legal issues and potential negative perceptions on our reputation.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> Concordia employees are encouraged to review the complete Policy on Signing Authority and Required Approvals for more details. There are also other important policies available on the Official Concordia Policies webpage that have been developed to clarify ambiguous situations, which may be relevant to employees within specific departments. See the question-and-answer section on the Human Resources page under &ldquo;policies and procedures&rdquo; for a full list of policies related to the awareness campaign.<br /> <b><br /> Related links:</b><br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Policy on Signing Authority and Required Approvals (BD-1)&nbsp; <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Official Policies page&nbsp; <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Code exists to protect&quot; &mdash; NOW, September 12, 2012 <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Policy awareness campaign highlights employee Code of Ethics&quot; &mdash; NOW, September 19, 2012 <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Protecting personal information&quot; &mdash; NOW, September 26, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Safety first&quot; &mdash; NOW, October 3, 2012&nbsp; <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Promoting a culture of safety&quot; &mdash; NOW, October 10, 2012&nbsp; <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Shining a light on harassment&quot; &mdash; NOW, October 17, 2012&nbsp; <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Policies and procedures Q&amp;A<br /> <br /> <br /> &nbsp;</p> 
</div></div>

                </div>
                <div class="parsys">




</div>

                <hr>
                <div class="related-links parbase picker">






</div>

            </div>
        </div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>
